content:
TRUE.

The 2023 UEFA Champions League Final was held at the Atatürk Olympic Stadium in Istanbul, Turkey, on June 10, 2023[1][2][3]. The event was the final match of the 2022–23 UEFA Champions League season, which is Europe's premier club football tournament organized by UEFA[1].

## Match and Venue Details

The final featured English club Manchester City against Italian club Inter Milan[1][4]. Manchester City won the match 1–0, with a second-half goal from Rodri, who was subsequently named Man of the Match by UEFA[1][3]. The match was attended by 71,412 people[3].

### Atatürk Olympic Stadium

The Atatürk Olympic Stadium is located in the Başakşehir district of Istanbul and is the largest stadium in Turkey[5]. Its seating capacity is cited as nearly 77,000, 75,000, or more specifically 74,753 spectators[2][6][5]. The stadium, which currently serves as a home venue for FC Karagümrük and the Turkish national team, was originally built to support Turkey's bid for the 2008 Olympic Games[7][6].

This was the second time the stadium hosted the UEFA Champions League final; the first was in 2005, a match between Liverpool and Milan[1].

## Host City Confirmation and Scheduling Changes

Multiple sources, including UEFA's official website, confirmed Istanbul as the host city and the Atatürk Olympic Stadium as the venue for the 2023 final[8][9][10].

Istanbul was originally slated to host an earlier final, but scheduling was adjusted due to the COVID-19 pandemic[11]. The venue was supposed to host the 2021 final, which was relocated to Porto[6][11]. Following the pandemic-related postponements and relocations, final hosts were shifted back a year, assigning the 2023 final to Istanbul[11]. UEFA also confirmed the future host cities, with London's Wembley Stadium for 2024 and Munich's Fussball Arena München for 2025[8][9].
